FuncDef:
The isis timer csnp command configures an interval at which CSNPs are sent on the broadcast network.
The undo isis timer csnp command restores the default value. The isis timer csnp command configures an interval at which CSNPs are sent on the broadcast network. The undo isis timer csnp command restores the default value. By default, the interval at which CSNPs are sent is 10 seconds.
CLIs: undo isis timer csnp [ <csnp-interval> ] [ level-1 | level-2 ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interval at which CSNPs are sent on a broadcast network.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535, in seconds.

Indicates the interval at which Level-1 CSNPs are sent.
-

Indicates the interval at which Level-2 CSNPs are sent.
If neither Level-1 nor Level-2 is specified, by default, the interval at which the CSNPs of the current level are sent is set.
-

ExtraInfo:
On a broadcast network, a DIS sends CSNPs periodically to enable all devices to synchronize LSDBs with one another. If a device finds that the local LSDB does not have a specific LSP or an existing LSP is not the latest one after the device has received a CSNP, the device will send a PSNP to request the corresponding LSP.
The interval at which CSNPs are sent can be configured using the isis timer csnp command.
